explanation:
To determine whether MHD_send_data_ can recursively call itself (directly or indirectly) we must inspect all functions it directly invokes and any functions reachable from them, as well as functions that call it (because indirect recursion can occur via callers/callees chains). Brief rationale for each symbol:

- pre_send_setopt: Direct callee of MHD_send_data_. Any calls it makes could lead back to MHD_send_data_.
- post_send_setopt: Direct callee of MHD_send_data_. Must be inspected for transitive calls that could form a cycle.
- MHD_DLOG: Callee of post_send_setopt (from the static graph). If MHD_DLOG (or things it calls) eventually reach MHD_send_data_, that would create indirect recursion.
- MHD_send_hdr_and_body_: Listed as a caller of MHD_send_data_ and also calls pre/post_send_setopt. It can participate in a cycle (e.g., MHD_send_data_ -> post_send_setopt -> ... -> MHD_send_hdr_and_body_ -> MHD_send_data_).
- MHD_connection_handle_write: Caller of MHD_send_data_. It contains many calls (per graph) that could form paths back to MHD_send_data_.
- MHD_send_sendfile_: Appears in callers/callees around pre/post_send_setopt and connection handling. Must be checked for paths back to MHD_send_data_.
- send_iov_nontls: Caller of pre_send_setopt/post_send_setopt (per the graph). Include because it could provide a path that links back to MHD_send_data_.
- MHD_send_iovec_: Callee of MHD_connection_handle_write; included because it may participate in transitive call chains leading back to the target.
- try_ready_normal_body: Callee of MHD_connection_handle_write; include for the same reason (possible transitive path back).
- check_write_done: Callee of MHD_connection_handle_write; include to rule out cycles via this path.
- connection_close_error: Callee of MHD_connection_handle_write; include to ensure no indirect calls to the target.
- MHD_update_last_activity_: Callee of MHD_connection_handle_write; include because it might call other functions that eventually call MHD_send_data_.
- str_conn_error_: Callee of MHD_connection_handle_write; include to verify no path back to MHD_send_data_.
- call_handlers: Caller of MHD_connection_handle_write (per graph). Include because recursion might traverse up into the handler/callback layer and back down to MHD_send_data_.

Inspecting the implementations (or the transitive static call graph entries) of these symbols is sufficient to determine whether any call chain starting at MHD_send_data_ can eventually call MHD_send_data_ again (i.e., to detect direct or indirect recursion).
